articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Greece has arrested a Georgian woman suspected of discarding a cigarette that helped trigger one of several wildfires razing land and threatening homes on the island of Chios.
articles.title: Greece holds Georgian suspected of fuelling Chios fire with cigarette

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Alexander Cornwell, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: The ceasefire brokered by U.S. President Donald Trump between Iran and Israel appeared to be holding on Wednesday a day after both countries signalled that their air war had ended, at least for now.
articles.title: Fragile ceasefire holding, Trump envoy says peace talks with Iran 'promising'

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Sabine Siebold, Jeff Mason
articles.description: NATO leaders gather in The Hague on Wednesday for a summit tailor-made for U.S. President Donald Trump, with European allies hoping a pledge to hike defence spending will prompt him to dispel doubts about his commitment to the alliance.
articles.title: NATO leaders set to back Trump defence spending goal at Hague summit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China and Taiwan clashed over their competing interpretations of history in an escalating war of words over what Beijing views as provocations from Taiwan's government, and said it is impossible to "invade" what is already Chinese land.
articles.title: China, Taiwan clash over history, Beijing says can't 'invade' what is already Chinese territory

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that the intelligence following the strikes on Iranian nuclear sites was inconclusive, but also suggested the damage could have been severe.
articles.title: Trump says intelligence on Iran was inconclusive, but suggests severe damage

articles.author: Maria Tsvetkova, Joseph Ax
articles.description: Cuomo faced a spirited challenge from 33-year-old Zohran Mamdani, a relatively unknown state lawmaker who has pulled away from 10 others in a crowded field of candidates.
articles.title: Mamdani on verge of winning New York City's Democratic mayoral contest after Cuomo concedes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Andrew Tate, an internet personality and self-described misogynist, faces a trial in Britain next year in four women's civil lawsuits for alleged physical and sexual abuse, after the case was brought forward on Wednesday.
articles.title: Andrew Tate's UK civil trial over abuse, coercive control allegations moved to 2026

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran's parliament approved a bill on Wednesday to suspend cooperation with the U.N. nuclear watchdog, state-affiliated news outlet Nournews reported.
articles.title: Iran's parliament approves bill on suspending cooperation with IAEA

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Leo appealed to Iran and Israel on Wednesday not to pursue vengeance after 12 days of war, which the U.S. joined with airstrikes in support of Israel to target Iran's uranium-enrichment facilities.
articles.title: Pope Leo appeals to Iran and Israel not to pursue vengeance after war

articles.author: Rami Amichay, Artorn Pookasook, Janis Laizans
articles.description: Pop music blared from a Tel Aviv school on Wednesday as children arrived for their first day back after 12 days of air war with Iran kept them confined to safe rooms and bomb shelters with stressed parents.
articles.title: Israelis welcome return to normal life, but fears for Gaza hostages resurface
